Package hanabAI

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • hanabAI.State
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class State
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Represent the game state in Hanabi. The state is designed as an immutable object. Agents are able to get the current game state, and all previous moves using a state object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      State​(java.lang.String[] players, java.util.Stack<Card> deck)
      A constructor for the first state in the game

      java.lang.String toString()

    • Constructor Detail

      • State

        public State​(java.lang.String[] players,
             java.util.Stack<Card> deck)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A constructor for the first state in the game
        Parameters:
        players - the names of the players in the game, in an array by index
        deck - the shuffled deck of cards to be used for the deal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null, or the wrong size

    • Method Detail

      • nextState

        public State nextState​(Action action,
                       java.util.Stack<Card> deck)
                throws IllegalActionException
        A method to create the next state from the given state and a move. This method will only work if no hand has been hidden (since it allows agents to infer the result of actions).
        Parameters:
        deck - the deck of cards
        action - the action made
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - if the move is not legal in the current state, or one hand has been hidden.

      • hideHand

        public State hideHand​(int observer)
               throws IllegalActionException
        A method to create a local state from a global state. That is, if there is no current observer, the specified observer will have their hand hidden from them.
        Parameters:
        observer - the player observing the game state
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - if the observer is out of bounds, or if the state is not global.

      • legalAction

        public boolean legalAction​(Action a)
                    throws IllegalActionException
        Test the legality of a Action. If the observer of a state is specified, this mathod can only be applied to actions performed by the observer.
        Parameters:
        a - the move to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the move is legal in the current game state.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException

      • getPlayers

        public java.lang.String[] getPlayers()
        Gives and array of all the player names in the game.
        Returns:
        an array containing the naems of the players in the game, by ther index in the game.

      • getHand

        public Card[] getHand​(int player)
               throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gives the cards of the specified player
        Parameters:
        player - the index of the player is the game
        Returns:
        an array of cards in player's hand, or an empty array, if the cards are hidden.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBounds - if there is no player of the given index.
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName​(int player)
        Gives a players name
        Returns:
        the name of the specified player

      • getPreviousState

        public State getPreviousState()
        Gives the previous state of the game, allowing agents to determine the recent actions in the game.
        Returns:
        the previous state, with the same observer as the current state.

      • getPreviousAction

        public Action getPreviousAction()
        Gets the last action performed in the game, before this state was reached
        Returns:
        the last action performed prior to this state.

      • getPreviousAction

        public Action getPreviousAction​(int player)
        Gets the last action performed in the game, by the specified player
        Returns:
        the last action performed by the given player, prior to this state.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOUtOfBoundsException - if the specified player has not yet performed an action

      • previousCardPlayed

        public Card previousCardPlayed()
        Gets the card played in the previous move, or null if it is the first move, or the previous move was a hint.
        Returns:
        the card played in the previous action, or null if there is no previous action, or the action was a hint.

      • getDiscards

        public java.util.Stack<Card> getDiscards()
        Gets a clone of the discard stack
        Returns:
        a clone of the discard stack

      • getFirework

        public java.util.Stack<Card> getFirework​(Colour c)
        Get the stack of cards representing the specified firework
        Returns:
        a clone of the stack of cards representing the firework of the given colour. The highest card is at the top of the stack.

      • getHintTokens

        public int getHintTokens()
        Get the number of hint tokens available
        Returns:
        number of hints remaining

      • getFuseTokens

        public int getFuseTokens()
        Get the number of fuse tokens available
        Returns:
        number of fuse tokens remaining

      • getObserver

        public int getObserver()
        Gets the observer, or -1 if global state
        Returns:
        the agent index of the observer, or -1 if that state is Global

      • getNextPlayer

        public int getNextPlayer()
        Gets the nextplayer, or -1 if gameOver
        Returns:
        the agent index of the nextplayer, or -1 if the game is over.

      • getOrder

        public int getOrder()
        Gets the order of the state, starting from 1.
        Returns:
        the order the state appears in the game, from first (1) to last.

      • getFinalActionIndex

        public int getFinalActionIndex()
        Returns the order of the final action, if it is known. When the final card is drawn from the deck, every player has one more action remaining. The order of the final action, is the order of the action that drew the final card, plus the number of players in the game.
        Returns:
        the order of the final action, or -1 if the deck is not empty

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Get the current score
        Returns:
        the sum of the highest value cards in each firework

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Tests if the game is over
        Returns:
        true if all fireworks have been made, the deck has run out, or a fues has exploded.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Produces a clone of the state
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string describing the state of the game, including: the state of each players hand; the top card of each fire work; and the last action.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
